item.dc:creator: Freddie Clayton
item.description: Has Europe had enough

media:content.media:description: Military personnel from the German armed Forces board a flight leaving on Jan. 18, 2026, in Nuuk, Greenland.

item.title: Europe may have reached its breaking point with Trump over Greenland tariffs

item.description: Iran’s supreme leader Ayatollah Khamenei is blaming the United States and President Donald Trump for inciting violence in the streets of Iran during which thousands of demonstrators have been killed by the regime. A U.S. based human rights group estimates about 3,000 protestors have been killed by Iranian security forces but activists suggest that number could be higher. NBC’s Molly Hunter reports for Sunday TODAY.

media:content.media:title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Blames Trump, US for Massive Protests
media:content.media:description: Iran’s supreme leader Ayatollah Khamenei is blaming the United States and President Donald Trump for inciting violence in the streets of Iran during which thousands of demonstrators have been killed by the regime. A U.S. based human rights group estimates about 3,000 protestors have been killed by Iranian security forces but activists suggest that number could be higher. NBC’s Molly Hunter reports for Sunday TODAY.

item.title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Blames Trump, US for Massive Protests

item.description: MINNEAPOLIS — Standing outside his son’s elementary school, a father heard a warning crackle over his walkie-talkie: a suspicious car nearby

media:content.media:text: Joe Dirkswager, 38, patrolling the streets near Bancroft Elementary School in Minneapolis on Friday.
media:content.media:description: Joe Dirkswager, 38, patrolling the streets near Bancroft Elementary School in Minneapolis on Friday.

media:content.media:text: Minneapolis public school families, educators and students hold signs during a news conference at Lake Hiawatha Park in Minneapolis, on Friday, Jan. 9, 2026, demanding Immigration and Customs Enforcement be kept out of schools.
media:content.media:description: Joe Dirkswager, 38, patrolling the streets near Bancroft Elementary School in Minneapolis on Friday.

media:content.media:text: Image: U.S. Border Patrol agents detain a person near Roosevelt High School

Joe Dirkswager, 38, patrolling the streets near Bancroft Elementary School in Minneapolis on Friday.

item.title: 'We protect our kids': Parents and neighbors guard streets around Minneapolis schools amid ICE fears

Julia Ainsley
Jon Schuppe
item.description: Federal officials are investigating the partner of Renee Nicole Good to determine whether she may have impeded a federal officer moments before he shot and killed Good in Minneapolis, sources say

media:content.media:text: A man visits a makeshift memorial for Renee Good on Jan. 14, 2026, at the site where she was killed a week ago in Minneapolis.
media:content.media:description: A man visits a makeshift memorial for Renee Good on Jan. 14, 2026, at the site where she was killed a week ago in Minneapolis.
High school students protest against ICE outside the Minnesota state Capitol in St. Paul on Jan. 14.

item.title: Federal officials investigating Renee Good's partner, sources say

item.dc:creator: Matt Lavietes
Selina Guevara
Shaquille Brewster
item.description: Chaos erupted outside City Hall on Saturday as hundreds of protesters confronted a right-wing provocateur who was among those pardoned for crimes tied to the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S.

media:content.media:description: Jake Lang, organizer of the protest March Against Minnesota Fraud, attends the rally in front of Minneapolis City Hall on Jan. 17, 2026.
Gary said he supports increased immigration operations in the area.
Sara Steck, 60, said she was braving the cold temperature to protest Lang’s demonstration because “this city is built on immigrants.”
Isabelle Brourman, a courtroom sketch artist who works in federal and immigration court, stood nearby sketching the scene.

item.title: Jan. 6 provocateur says he was stabbed at pro-ICE Minneapolis rally

item.dc:creator: Adam Edelman
item.description: Republicans, who haven’t won a statewide race in Minnesota in two decades, see a moment to break through. But there are still many factors stacked against them.

media:content.media:description: Federal law enforcement agents confront anti-ICE protesters during a demonstration outside the Bishop Whipple Federal Building in Minneapolis on Jan. 15, 2026.
MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell is among the candidates in the crowded Republican primary for Minnesota governor.
Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz is not seeking a third term.

item.title: Fraud scandal and ICE unrest scramble 2026 races in blue-leaning Minnesota

item.title: The 'Cardiac' Bears keep making comeback wins, but can they sustain it?

item.description: Denver Broncos quarterback Bo Nix’s season is done after he broke a bone in his right ankle late in the Broncos’ 33-30 overtime win against the Buffalo Bills on Saturday

media:content.media:description: Denver Broncos quarterback Bo Nix (10) celebrates the win against the Buffalo Bills in an NFL divisional playoff football game, Sunday, Jan. 18, 2026 in Denver. (AP Photo/Bart Young)
Nix shakes hands with Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen at the end of Saturday's game.

item.title: Bo Nix breaks ankle during Broncos' overtime win over the Bills

item.description: A new app is going viral in China that helps people who live alone to check in with their friends and family. Users hit a green button on the app daily and if there's no response will reach out to the emergency contacts. NBC News' Steven Romo looks at the app's popularity and what it says about wider issues.

media:content.media:title: New app 'Are You Dead?' from China works as check-in tool for people living alone
media:content.media:description: A new app is going viral in China that helps people who live alone to check in with their friends and family. Users hit a green button on the app daily and if there's no response will reach out to the emergency contacts. NBC News' Steven Romo looks at the app's popularity and what it says about wider issues.

item.title: New app 'Are You Dead?' from China works as check-in tool for people living alone

item.description: Snow blanketed highways and neighborhoods from Long Island to the Florida Panhandle overnight, turning familiar roads into winter scenes rarely seen that far south and snarling travel across the eastern half of the U.S. during a busy holiday weekend

media:content.media:description: A snowplow clears an intersection in Ashburnham, Mass., on Jan. 17.

item.title: Rare Southern snow and Northeast storm disrupt holiday travel plans across U.S.
